IRS990.MissionDesc: THE MISSION OF THE DIABETES ASSOCIATION, INC. IS TO IMPROVE THE HEALTH AND WELL-BEING OF THE COMMUNITIES THAT THE DIABETES ASSOCIATION, INC. SERVES BY ADVANCING DIABETES PREVENTION, EARLY DETECTION, EDUCATION AND DISEASE MANAGEMENT.
IRS990.Desc: ADULT SERVICES- PROVIDED INFORMATION AND REFERRAL, AS WELL AS EDUCATIONAL AND RECREATIONAL PROGRAMS FOR ADULTS IN THE AREAS OF DIABETES PREVENTION AND CONTROL, FOR OVER 313 INDIVIDUALS IN FY2018.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: YOUTH SERVICES - PROVIDED EDUCATIONAL AND RECREATIONAL PROGRAMS FOR 35 YOUTH IN THE GREATER FALL RIVER AREA, IN ORDER TO GIVE THOSE WITH DIABETES A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF THE DISEASE.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: CAMP- CAMP JACK PROVIDES A SAFE, ACTIVE PROGRAM TO HELP TO FOSTER FRIENDSHIPS AMONG CHILDREN WITH DIABETES, THEIR SIBLINGS, AND FRIENDS WHILE ALSO ENABLING THEM TO LEARN ABOUT THE COMMON CHALLENGES OF DIABETES. OVER 84 CHILDREN WERE PROVIDED A CAMP EXPERIENCE IN FY2018.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE AGENCY HAS ADOPTED INVESTMENT AND SPENDING POLICIES FOR ENDOWMENT ASSETS THAT ATTEMPT TO PROVIDE A PREDICTABLE STREAM OF FUNDING TO PROGRAMS SUPPORTED BY THE ENDOWMENT WHILE SEEKING TO MAINTAIN THE PURCHASING POWER OF THE ENDOWMENT ASSETS.

THE AGENCY IS EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAXES AS A PUBLIC CHARITY UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE UNITED STATES INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. MANAGEMENT BELIEVES THAT THE AGENCY OPERATES IN A MANNER CONSISTENT WITH THEIR TAX-EXEMPT STATUS AT BOTH THE STATE AND FEDERAL LEVEL. THE AGENCY ANNUALLY FILES IRS FORM 990 - RETURN OF ORGANIZATION EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAX, REPORTING VARIOUS INFORMATION THAT THE IRS USES TO MONITOR THE ACTIVITIES OF TAX-EXEMPT ENTITIES. THESE TAX RETURNS ARE SUBJECT TO REVIEW BY THE TAXING AUTHORITIES, GENERALLY FOR THREE YEARS AFTER THEY WERE FILED. THE AGENCY CURRENTLY HAS NO TAX EXAMINATIONS IN PROGRESS.

PARTICIPANTS IN A SUPPLEMENTAL NONQUALIFIED RETIREMENT PLAN FUNDED BY A RELATED ORGANIZATION: ROBERT CANUEL - PRESIDENT FOR PEOPLE, INCORPORATED: $124,879 WILLIAM PERKINS - CEO FOR PEOPLE, INCORPORATED: $22,182 MEGAN SCHEFFER - COO FOR PEOPLE, INCORPORATED: $23,890

BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.TransactionDesc: THE RELATED ORGANIZATION, PEOPLE, INCORPORATED PURCHASED WORKERS' COMPENSATION INSURANCE FROM F.X. PERON INSURANCE AGENCY, WHICH IS OWNED BY MR. BEDARD.
THE RELATED ORGANIZATION, PEOPLE, INCORPORATED UTILIZES THE PRINTING SERVICES OF MALLARD PRINTING COMPANY, WHICH IS OWNED BY MR. MARQUES.

DENNIS READ IS THE RELATED ORGANIZATION, PEOPLE, INCORPORATED'S BROKER FOR HEALTH AND DENTAL BENEFITS. HE RECEIVED COMMISSIONS FROM BLUE CROSS AND ALTUS DENTAL RELATED TO PEOPLE, INCORPORATED'S POLICIES.
THE RELATED ORGANIZATION, PEOPLE, INCORPORATED, PURCHASED GENERAL LIABILITY INSURANCE THROUGH RUA DUMONT AUDET INSURANCE AGENCY, INC., OF WHICH MR. RUA IS A PRINCIPAL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS PREPARED BY THE EXTERNAL AUDITORS AND REVIEWED BY MANAGEMENT. REVISIONS, CORRECTIONS, ETC. ARE MADE AS NECESSARY. ONCE ALL ARE SATISFIED WITH THE FORM, IT IS FINALIZED AND A COPY IS SENT TO ALL BOARD MEMBERS. NO REVIEW WAS OR WILL BE CONDUCTED BY THE BOARD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EACH YEAR THE ORGANIZATION'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS PROVIDED TO ALL OFFICERS, DIRECTORS AND KEY EMPLOYEES. THESE PEOPLE ARE ASKED TO REVIEW THE POLICY AND SIGN A STATEMENT INDICATING THAT THEY UNDERSTAND THE POLICY, HAVE REPORTED ALL POTENTIAL CONFLICTS DURING THE PAST YEAR IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE POLICY AND WILL REPORT ALL POTENTIAL CONFLICTS DURING THE COMING YEAR. ALL POTENTIAL CONFLICTS ARE EVALUATED BY THE BOARD TO DETERMINE IF A CONFLICT ACTUALLY EXISTS. IN THOSE INSTANCES WHERE THE POTENTIAL TRANSACTION IS A CONFLICT THE BOARD EXAMINES THE TRANSACTION AND A VOTE IS TAKEN (WITH THOSE INVOLVED RECUSING THEMSELVES) AS TO WHETHER THE ORGANIZATION WILL ENTER INTO THE TRANSACTION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL EMPLOYEES ARE PAID BY PEOPLE, INCORPORATED. SALARIES AND BENEFITS ARE DETERMINED BY PEOPLE, INCORPORATED'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND MANAGEMENT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS (ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION AND BY-LAWS), ITS CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST. THE ORGANIZATION WILL MAIL COPIES UPON REQUEST OR PROVIDE COPIES TO THOSE WHO COME TO THE ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICE DURING NORMAL BUSINESS HOURS. THE ORGANIZATION CHARGES FOR THE COPIES IN ACCORDANCE WITH IRS REGULATIONS.

IdRelatedTaxExemptOrgGrp.PrimaryActivitiesTxt: PROVIDE SERVICES FOR CHILDREN AND ADULTS
OPERATES UNITS OF LOW INCOME HOUSING

IdRelatedTaxExemptOrgGrp.PrimaryActivitiesTxt: PROVIDE AFFORDABLE HOUSING TO LOW AND MODERATE-INCOME PEOPLE
